entries.title: The Triumphant Return of Zoidberg -- A Modular Perl Shell
entries.text: Joel Berger announces a new version of the Perl shell. Cleaned and washed and ready to party.

entries.title: use B::Stats to check for less bloat
entries.text: Reini Urban gives us a couple of examples where little, innosent looking modules eat up a lot of memory. He also point to tools to check memory footprint. Memory optimization might be an important field we have been neglecting in the Perl/CPAN community. Or maybe it's just me.

entries.title: The Ten Minute Thinking Rule
entries.text: I love the way Chisel explains how to get people to start thinking about a problem they face. It isn't always possible but I think it can work very well. Much better than saying RTFM or by giving them the solution.

entries.title: Announcing MooseX::Types::NumUnit for scientific simulations
entries.text: Joel Berger is doing scientific simulations so he needed complex types that understand things like ft/s  (or m/s for those in the metric system).

entries.title: YAPC::NA has a suggestion box that you can vote on
entries.text: Usually I don't link to the small blog entries regarind next years YAPC::NA but this one I liked very much. This 'Mob Rater' let's you suggest ideas for YAPC::NA and vote on the other ideas listed. I think this is a nice idea and the results could be used by any YAPC or Perl workshop. So even if you don't plan to attend YAPC::NA I'd suggest you go put in your suggestions and vote on the other ones.
